title: 10 Insights from Alaska School Enrollment Data
text: Alaska’s public school enrollment steady decline, dropping around 132,000 130,000 students recent years. Last Frontier losing families.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2025)  state_totals <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) |>   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = round(change / lag(n_students) * 100, 2))  state_totals ggplot(state_totals, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2, color = "#003366") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#003366") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Alaska Public School Enrollment (2019-2025)",     subtitle = "Steady decline as families leave the Last Frontier",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Enrollment"   )

title: 10 Insights from Alaska School Enrollment Data
text: Anchorage School District educates nearly half Alaska students. Anchorage sneezes, Alaska catches cold.
code: enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  top_districts <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, n_students)  top_districts top_districts |>   mutate(district_name = forcats::fct_reorder(district_name, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = district_name, fill = district_name)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = scales::comma(n_students)), hjust = -0.1, size = 3.5) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_viridis_d(option = "mako", begin = 0.2, end = 0.8) +   labs(     title = "Top 10 Alaska Districts by Enrollment (2025)",     subtitle = "Anchorage dominates with nearly half of all students",     x = "Number of Students",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from Alaska School Enrollment Data
text: Remote villages limited internet access faced unique pandemic challenges. Enrollment patterns diverged sharply urban rural districts.
code: covid_enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2022)  covid_changes <- covid_enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          end_year %in% c(2020, 2021)) |>   pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n_students) |>   mutate(pct_change = round((`2021` / `2020` - 1) * 100, 1)) |>   arrange(pct_change) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, `2020`, `2021`, pct_change)  covid_changes

what: 4. Alaska Native students are a quarter of enrollment
title: 10 Insights from Alaska School Enrollment Data
text: Alaska Native American Indian students make 22-25% enrollment statewide–far higher state except Hawaii.
code: demographics <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("native_american", "white", "asian", "black", "hispanic", "multiracial")) |>   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) |>   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) |>   arrange(desc(n_students))  demographics demographics |>   mutate(subgroup = forcats::fct_reorder(subgroup, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = subgroup, fill = subgroup)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0(pct, "%")), hjust = -0.1) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2") +   labs(     title = "Alaska Student Demographics (2025)",     subtitle = "Alaska Native students comprise a quarter of enrollment",     x = "Number of Students",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from Alaska School Enrollment Data
text: Kindergarten enrollment canary coal mine. Alaska’s K numbers weak years, signaling decline ahead.
code: grade_trends <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "12")) |>   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students) |>   pivot_wider(names_from = grade_level, values_from = n_students)  grade_trends enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "12")) |>   ggplot(aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = grade_level)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   scale_color_manual(values = c("K" = "#E69F00", "12" = "#56B4E9")) +   labs(     title = "Kindergarten vs 12th Grade Enrollment",     subtitle = "Weak kindergarten numbers signal continued decline",     x = "School Year",     y = "Enrollment",     color = "Grade"   )

what: 6. The Mat-Su Valley bucks the trend
title: 10 Insights from Alaska School Enrollment Data
text: Anchorage shrinks, Matanuska-Susitna Borough School District (Palmer/Wasilla area) growing, attracting families leaving big city.
code: matsu <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Mat-Su|Matanuska", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students)  matsu enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Mat-Su|Matanuska|Anchorage", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) |>   group_by(district_name) |>   mutate(index = round(n_students / first(n_students) * 100, 1)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = end_year, y = index, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   geom_hline(yintercept = 100, linetype = "dashed", color = "gray50") +   labs(     title = "Anchorage vs Mat-Su: Diverging Paths",     subtitle = "Indexed to 2019 = 100",     x = "School Year",     y = "Enrollment Index",     color = "District"   )

title: 10 Insights from Alaska School Enrollment Data
text: Small rural districts fewer 100 students face existential challenges. haven’t reported enrollment recent years.
code: small_districts <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   filter(n_students < 200) |>   arrange(n_students) |>   select(district_name, n_students)  small_districts

title: 10 Insights from Alaska School Enrollment Data
text: gap 9th grade 12th grade enrollment reveals retention challenges vary dramatically district.
code: pipeline <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("09", "12")) |>   pivot_wider(names_from = grade_level, values_from = n_students) |>   mutate(ratio = round(`12` / `09` * 100, 1)) |>   filter(`09` >= 50) |>   arrange(ratio) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, `09`, `12`, ratio)  pipeline

what: 9. Fairbanks is shrinking faster than Anchorage
title: 10 Insights from Alaska School Enrollment Data
text: Fairbanks North Star Borough School District seen steeper percentage declines Anchorage recent years. interior emptying .
code: major_districts <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Fairbanks|Anchorage", district_name)) |>   group_by(district_name) |>   mutate(index = round(n_students / first(n_students) * 100, 1)) |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students, index)  major_districts enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Fairbanks|Anchorage", district_name)) |>   group_by(district_name) |>   mutate(index = round(n_students / first(n_students) * 100, 1)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = end_year, y = index, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   geom_hline(yintercept = 100, linetype = "dashed", color = "gray50") +   scale_color_manual(values = c("#003366", "#CC5500")) +   labs(     title = "Fairbanks vs Anchorage: Who's Shrinking Faster?",     subtitle = "Indexed to 2019 = 100",     x = "School Year",     y = "Enrollment Index",     color = "District"   )

title: 10 Insights from Alaska School Enrollment Data
text: Alaska schools accessible plane boat. remote schools serve communities fewer 50 students across areas larger states.
code: smallest <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(n_students) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, n_students)  smallest

title: 10 Insights from Alaska School Enrollment Data
text: Alaska’s school enrollment data reveals: Steady decline: Last Frontier losing students year year Anchorage dominance: One district educates nearly half state Alaska Native presence: quarter students Alaska Native Urban-suburban shift: Mat-Su grows Anchorage Fairbanks shrink Rural challenges: Tiny bush districts face existential threats patterns shape school funding debates facility planning across America’s largest remote state. Data sourced Alaska Department Education Early Development Data Center.

title: Alaska School Data
text: Alaska’s public school enrollment steady decline, dropping around 132,000 130,000 students recent years. Last Frontier losing families.
code: library(akschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students))

title: Alaska School Data
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("almartin82/akschooldata")

title: Alaska School Data
code: library(akschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)  # State totals enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Demographics enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "native_american", "asian", "black", "hispanic")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

title: Alaska School Data
code: import pyakschooldata as ak  # Fetch one year enr_2025 = ak.fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi = ak.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025])  # State totals state_totals = enr_2025[     (enr_2025['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2025['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2025['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # District breakdown districts = enr_2025[     (enr_2025['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2025['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2025['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)  # Demographics demographics = enr_2025[     (enr_2025['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2025['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') &     (enr_2025['subgroup'].isin(['white', 'native_american', 'asian', 'black', 'hispanic'])) ][['subgroup', 'n_students', 'pct']]

what: akschooldata: Fetch and Process Alaska School Data — akschooldata-package
title: akschooldata: Fetch and Process Alaska School Data — akschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Alaska Department Education Early Development (DEED). Provides functions fetching enrollment data including October 1 counts school, district, grade level, demographic groups, transforming tidy format analysis.

title: akschooldata: Fetch and Process Alaska School Data — akschooldata-package
text: IMPORTANT: package uses Alaska DEED data sources. federal data sources (NCES CCD, Urban Institute API, etc.) used.

title: akschooldata: Fetch and Process Alaska School Data — akschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations get_available_years View available year range import_local_deed_enrollment Import locally downloaded DEED files

title: akschooldata: Fetch and Process Alaska School Data — akschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: akschooldata: Fetch and Process Alaska School Data — akschooldata-package
text: data sourced directly Alaska DEED: DEED Data Center: https://education.alaska.gov/data-center DEED Statistics: https://education.alaska.gov/stats Enrollment Files: https://education.alaska.gov/Stats/enrollment/ package downloads two Excel files school year: Enrollment School Grade (grade-level counts) Enrollment School Ethnicity (demographic breakdowns)

title: akschooldata: Fetch and Process Alaska School Data — akschooldata-package
text: Available years: 2019-2025 (Excel files DEED Statistics Portal)

title: akschooldata: Fetch and Process Alaska School Data — akschooldata-package
text: Alaska unique demographic composition: 22% Alaska Native/American Indian (highest US) 3% Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander (among highest US) Approximately 131,000 total students 53 school districts (plus Mt. Edgecumbe High School)

title: akschooldata: Fetch and Process Alaska School Data — akschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com

title: Clear the akschooldata cache — clear_cache
text: Removes cached data files.

code: clear_cache(end_year = NULL, type = NULL)

title: Clear the akschooldata cache — clear_cache
text: end_year Optional school year clear. NULL, clears years. type Optional data type clear. NULL, clears types.

title: Clear the akschooldata cache — clear_cache
text: Invisibly returns number files removed

title: Clear the akschooldata cache — clear_cache
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Clear all cached data clear_cache()  # Clear only 2024 data clear_cache(2024)  # Clear only tidy format data clear_cache(type = "tidy") } # }

title: Fetch Alaska enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Alaska DEED. Data includes October 1 counts school, district, grade level, demographic groups.

title: Fetch Alaska enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: fetch_enr(end_year, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE)

title: Fetch Alaska enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2019-2025. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download source.

title: Fetch Alaska enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_name, school_name, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Alaska enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to Anchorage School District anchorage <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(grepl("Anchorage", district_name)) } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: fetch_enr_multi(end_years, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE)

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
